He's a nature lover. But, he's also an excellent, calm boy when crated. It doesn't take much to please this guy. Meatloaf is ready to go home today!

name: Fudge
description_html: True to his name, Fudge is as sweet as they come! He is a gentle soul who will shower you with love and devotion. Fudge is house‚Äëtrained, walks well on leash, and has a heart full of affection to share. He‚Äôs mellow by nature, the kind of dog who will happily sit by your side and gaze at you with soulful eyes that seem to look straight into your heart.

name: Figgy Puddin'
description_html: Figgy Puddin is an absolute charmer! He's easy for walks and loves to get his wiggles out in a play yard. Figgy has a gentle curiosity for other dogs and people that he sees on his outings. Once play time is over, he's happy to just hang out and watch the world while getting cuddles from his friends. This affectionate and easy going guy is the perfect catch!

name: Quin
description_html:
Quin is a gentle, shy, incredibly sweet dog who has been through far more than most pups should ‚Äî and yet he remains soft, playful, and eager to connect with people. Volunteers describe him as easy to leash, easy to walk, and a joy to spend time with. He enjoys treats, learns quickly, and loves relaxing on the couch or exploring outside.


Before coming to the shelter, Quin lived peacefully with his finders‚Äô resident dogs and has shown no dog reactivity while at the shelter. He never fails to greet volunteers with wagging softness and calm manners. Once he feels safe, his personality opens up ‚Äî he‚Äôs playful, affectionate, and loves showing off his tricks.


Quin is treat-motivated and appears to be house-trained. While he starts his walks with enthusiastic pulling, he settles into an easy pace after a while. He can be a little shy at first, especially in noisy areas, and may be sensitive to strangers reaching into his space, so he‚Äôll do best with someone who can let him warm up gently at his own pace.


Quin would thrive with:

‚úî A calm, patient home

‚úî Adults or older teens who respect his space

‚úî A resident dog who enjoys soft, friendly company (meet-and-greets available!)

‚úî Positive reinforcement and predictable routines


If you already have a dog, our behavior team can help set up a meet & greet to make sure it‚Äôs a great fit.


Quin is a truly good dog who has handled life's highs and lows with remarkable grace. Come meet him ‚Äî you‚Äôll be amazed by how much sweetness and heart he brings to the moment.

name: Miles
description_html:
Miles is an absolute sweetheart who will melt your heart the moment you meet him. He has puppy-like charm!

On leash, Miles is a dream‚Äîhe walks with a loose leash and rarely pulls, preferring to take his time and thoughtfully sniff his surroundings.

In the play yard, his playful side shines! Miles loves a good game of fetch and is impressively polite about it. He happily drops the toy right at your feet, and if you don‚Äôt notice, he‚Äôll adorably nudge it closer, pick it up, and place it right into your hand. Watching him run around with his bouncy little hops is guaranteed to make you smile.

Indoors, Miles settles beautifully. In a real-life room, he explored a bit before relaxing on the couch with a toy, showing just how well he can switch from playtime to cuddle time.

Miles would make a fantastic companion for someone looking for a sweet, playful pup. He‚Äôs truly a precious baby who‚Äôs ready to bring joy, laughter, and love into his forever home.

name: Lady
description_html: If you are looking for a sweet, easy going cuddle bug then Lady is your girl! She would love nothing more than to cuddle up on the couch to watch tv and relax with you.

name: K‚Äôjay
description_html: K'Jay had to be surrendered due to their owner's health issues. This big boy is a cuddler who loves praise! Tell him what a good boy he is and he will be happy the whole day about it. This friendly boy will gladly sit in your lap or lean in to be closer to you. He is one of the most house trained dogs at the shelter. He is big and beautiful. He is a very good boy, who is making lots of human friends amongst the volunteers. He is being very brave, after losing his home and family. He is like a big polar bear that you just want to hug. He's still working on his leash manners and doesn't always realize his own size or strength but he responds well to gentle coaxing. K'Jay is a young, smart guy who is eager to please and loves learning! He so deserves to be running and playing for hours, as he is a young dog.

name: Bellanova
description_html:
To say that Bellanova doesn‚Äôt like other pets is a bit of an understatement. She REALLY doesn‚Äôt like them.

Bellanova suffers from anxiety, and does best when on medication (she was previously on gabapentin, and it worked very well for her). Her previous owner loved her dearly, but could no longer take care of her, so they brought her to AAC. We would LOVE to get her into a real home, either through adoption or through foster (she does best with women).

Her owner told us that Bellanova is playful, talkative, independent, and high energy. She will give hard love bites when she‚Äôs overstimulated. Due to her anxiety, she is afraid of almost everything, and when she is startled, she is likely to attack. As long as she is on medication, she is well-behaved.

Bellanova must go to a home with no other pets and a very cat-savvy adopter. 

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Bellanova and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Rudolph
description_html:
This sweet, floppy-eared pup is as cute as his name suggests. Rudolph is a young, energetic bundle of joy who loves nothing more than playtime and cuddles. Whether he's chasing after a tennis ball or curling up beside you for snuggles, he does everything with a big, happy heart.

Rudolph is a fetch champion in the making and absolutely lights up when he sees a toy. He‚Äôs also a dream on walks‚Äîno pulling, no zig-zagging‚Äîjust a gentle little trot from a very good boy who loves exploring the world by your side.

Playful, affectionate, and endlessly cheerful, Rudolph is ready to bring joy to a lucky family. If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet companion who‚Äôll keep you smiling and your heart full, come meet this happy fella today!


email blueplusbusters@gmail.com for more info!

name: Daisy
description_html:
Foster Day 1!

‚Ä¢ Calm and relaxed in the car; enjoyed the window and laid down comfortably

‚Ä¢ Slow but calm exploring the new house; a little timid but not reactive

‚Ä¢ Follows me closely and shows strong trust/bond with humans

‚Ä¢ Overall temperament: gentle, people-oriented, calm, slightly shy in new environments


Daisy is very human oriented and is fully house trained! She needs a little work walking on the leash, but she loves walks! She is the sweetest girl, all she wants is to lay her head on you and be pet. I believe she is the perfect family dog or for anyone that doesn‚Äôt have any current pets in the house! She loves car rides, sniffing around outside, playing with the bone, ball, etc! She also is a very big cuddler, and stays off furniture unless invited on!

name: Edmond
description_html:
Sweet Edmond has had a rough start to life. He was found living on the streets with two other dogs, doing his best to survive day by day. When his little group was rescued, Edmond was understandably overwhelmed by all the changes. After the female dog he was closest to was taken to the shelter, he completely shut down in his finder‚Äôs home ‚Äî his world had suddenly become a much lonelier place.


Despite his fear, Edmond has a gentle soul. He‚Äôs not ready to seek out affection yet, but he watches the world with soft, hopeful eyes ‚Äî you can tell he wants to trust.

Edmond will need a very patient, understanding foster or adopter who can give him time to feel safe again.


A calm home, possibly another friendly and confident dog, and someone who can offer stability and kindness will help him blossom at his own pace.


If you have the heart to help a scared dog learn that the world can be kind, Edmond is waiting for you.

name: Onyx
description_html:
Meet Onyx! üñ§üêæ


Onyx is a sweet, playful boy who loves to cuddle and enjoys spending time with other dogs‚Äîespecially his bonded buddy, Cheddar. He‚Äôs affectionate, social, and happiest when he has toys to play with and a cozy spot to snuggle into.


If you‚Äôre looking for a pair of loving companions with gentle hearts and a fun side, Onyx (and Cheddar) could be your perfect match.

name: Lil Baby Lou
description_html:
Yes, he‚Äôs 95 pounds.


Yes, his name is Lil Baby Lou.

And yes‚Ä¶ he is absolutely, unquestionably a baby.


Lou is a dog built like a linebacker but powered entirely by love, snuggles, and the belief that he was meant to be a lap dog. Don‚Äôt let the size fool you‚Äîthis big boy‚Äôs favorite activities include cuddling, being near his people, and giving hugs. His heart is as soft as a marshmallow. 


Lil Baby Lou is extremely house trained (a true gentleman), rides like a champ in the car, and is always down for a good toy session. Toss him a toy and you‚Äôll see his playful, goofy side shine‚Äîthen he‚Äôll happily settle in for some quality couch time. If you‚Äôve ever wanted a giant teddy bear who thinks he‚Äôs a baby and has total soul dog potential, Lou is your guy. 


Come meet Lil Baby Lou‚Äîhe promises to take up space in your home, on your couch, and most importantly, in your heart. Email orangedotcrew@gmail.com to learn more and kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Ranger
description_html:
Ranger is a charming Husky-mix with a heart as bright as his snowy coat. Ranger is a soulful, gentle companion; he is a total dream on the leash, maintaining a polite, steady pace that makes every stroll through the neighborhood a relaxing joy.

With his striking amber eyes and attentive, upright ears, Ranger is always tuned in to his human‚Äôs needs. Whether you‚Äôre heading out for a morning adventure or enjoying a quiet afternoon, his sweet nature makes him the perfect cuddly partner.

name: Pickles
description_html:
Pickles is mellow for a floppy puppy. He is curious and intelligent, knowing sit and other commands. He looks at you in the eyes and is ready to follow you anywhere, especially if cheese is involved. He has been unlucky in that he's been back in quarantine for a cold for a while, then the pneumovirus outbreak happened. If this sweet boy saw more people, he'd be snatched up.


RE In Foster: If you're looking for SNUGGLES, ADVENTURE, and a dog with CHARACTER, Pickles is the perfect fur baby for you! He's very intelligent for a puppy, already knowing the basic commands (sit + shake - we're working on lay down) and fairly good at walking on a leash in public (he responds to heel!). He's a large puppy with the mindset of a small lap dog, he LOVES a good cuddle sesh and sleeping in, and he always surprises us with the variety of funny ways he likes to snooze! He goes crazy for his stuffed animals, BALLS, and tug of war toys. Besides being playful, he's extremely food motivated and unfortunately a very messy drinker - we're trying to teach him to wipe his mouth but it's not going well. Pickles grows to be pretty protective of the people he loves, but he's open minded to meeting new people slowly. We're still working a bit on his teething, but I'm sure with training and love from his forever family it's a habit he'll grow out of quickly! Pickles is a SWEETHEART and is so excited to be with his forever family and show off his goofy, clumsy, and loving personality! (Jan 29, 2026)

name: Mercury
description_html:
This bright-eyed, friendly, confident girl is brimming with curiosity and that irresistible puppy energy that makes everything an adventure.


The Basics:

  • Already knows: sit, stay, down. Is learning: leave it, come here and loose leash walking.
  • Loves: peanut butter, bananas, belly scratches, sunbathing, shoes
  • Not a fan of: vacuum cleaners, lettuce

Her Personality: She's your loyal sidekick who doesn't want to miss a thing. She'll follow you room to room, not on your lap but definitely nearby, keeping tabs on all the action. When she finally settles, she'll rest that sweet head right against you.


Living Situation:

Crate trained (with encouragement and maybe a bribe)

  • Other dogs? YES PLEASE. She pulls toward every pup on walks and would likely love a canine companion
  • Cats? Questionable. Lives with one now but is very interested‚Äîmaybe too interested

What She Needs: Someone ready to guide a smart, affectionate puppy through her learning curve. She's got the foundation, the enthusiasm, and the tail wags‚Äîshe just needs you to help her become her best self. Follow her on IG @mercthegherkin

name: Misty
description_html:
Misty is an absolute sweetheart who steals hearts the moment you meet her. This precious girl is a true cuddle bug who loves to snuggle, walks nicely on leash, and is house trained‚Äîbasically a dream companion.


She can be a little shy at first, but she warms up quickly and loves playing with toys in the play yard. She can even entertain herself with her favorite toys, making her a lovely mix of gentle and playful.


If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet, affectionate pup who will happily curl up by your side, Misty might just be the one.

name: Flora
description_html: Flora is the sweetest cuddlebug. She's a long and low, short shiny black coat with white blazes. Her ears are luxurious, her tail is super wags. I found her on the streets a couple months ago, her history is unknown - she's on a grand adventure and looking for her forever people. Her top priorities are snuggles and pillow princess naps, and activities such as supervising squirrels and sticks, and rumpus time with toys or dog friends. Flora loves doing whatever you're doing. She's well-behaved and engaged on walks, plays well with my dog, and learns games and tricks easily. If left to her own devices, she'll make a nest of any available pillows and chill. She's untested with children, but she's a mama, very gentle and sweet with everyone. Flora is housetrained, solid on basic commands, treat motivated and eager to please. She's working on leash reactivity, and responding well to redirection. Flora is so chill, when you give her a loving home she'll be happy with the daily activities of your household. Flora is spayed and chipped, up to date on vaccinations, and takes Symparica Trio monthly. She's in great shape, no known conditions.

name: Crosby
description_html: Crosby is terrified in the shelter. This shy boy was abandoned so we understand his difficulty trusting us so soon in his stay at the shelter. But, we'd really love for him to have a true friend, the one he deserves in a home, and we suspect he will be a loyal companion to whoever offers him their friendship. If not adopted soon, we'd love to see Crosby in foster care where he can relax and come out of his shell gradually. He will do best in a low traffic, quiet spot with someone who can provide consistent, gentle attempts at interaction while also giving him the space he requests to adapt.

name: Vic
description_html:
Vic is a Cactus Cat learning to trust people more! Cactus Cats are shy but usually really love cat companions and do well in homes with other cats. Vic will need a calm place where he can continue his nose-boop training (a confidence building exercise that helps kitties build relationships with people). Luckily this boy loves Churu, so this is an easy reward for his hard work. He enjoys pets, you just have to go slowly and reward his bravery with his favorite treat!

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Vic and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Shadow
description_html: Handsome greyhound Shadow is a happy, friendly dog who walks easily on leash and is very housetrained. He loves to romp around the play yard, running zoomies and chasing balls. Shadow also enjoys playing along the fence line with other social dogs. He responds promptly to basic commands and gently accepts treats. Shadow is a sweet, playful boy who will make a wonderful companion in a loving home. Shadow looks like a show dog. He has a prince-like quality. He‚Äôs fancy! Come meet him!

name: Fezziwig
description_html:
Fezziwig is a Cactus Cat learning to trust people more! Cactus Cats are shy but usually really love cat companions and do well in homes with other cats. Fezziwig will need a calm place where he can continue his nose-boop training (a confidence building exercise that helps kitties build relationships with people). He may also do well in a home with a confident cat to show him that people aren't scary. We would love for Fezziwig to continue his journey with a patient adopter willing to give him the space and opportunity he needs to grow.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Fezziwig and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Liam
description_html: Teddy and Liam came in together and love each other very much, so they should be adopted together. These boys arrived at the shelter when their owner was no longer physically able to care for them. Teddy is a cuddly lap cat who loves to play with toys. He's talkative and has no problem sharing his feelings with you. Liam is quiet, shy and more on the independent side, but he also enjoys play time. Liam is a calm soul who is content to hang out near his people and enjoy their company. These boys have been through a lot of change, so they may take a little time adapting to new situations. Give Teddy and Liam a chance today!

name: Princess Peach
description_html: Meet Princess Peach! She really wants you because she loves new friends. This girl enjoys walks, play time and cuddling with her friends, and if you give her a toy to carry around it will truly make her day! Princess Peach is housetrained and crate trained. She's ready to take on the world with a toy in her mouth and a friend by her side, so say "hello" to this girl today!

name: Elf
description_html:
Elf is ready to be your sidekick best friend for adventures around Austin. This handsome, 1-year-old brindle pup is a 50-pound bundle of joy and athletic energy.

Elf is the ultimate fun-sized pup. He‚Äôs the perfect age‚Äîpast the puppy stage, but still full of youthful curiosity, playfulness, and treat-motivated for trainability. Whether it‚Äôs playing fetch, chasing toys, going for a hike, or investigating the sights and sounds of the neighborhood, Elf is ready to jump in with tail-wagging enthusiasm.

With his striking coat and soulful eyes, Elf is as charming as he is active. He‚Äôs looking for an upbeat home that matches his zest for life and love for the outdoors.

Interested in Elf? Reach out to blueplusbusters@gmail.com for more info!

name: Bear
description_html:
Meet Bear!


Bear was surrendered to the shelter after losing his home to a fire. He's still pretty new to the shelter but this is what we have discovered so far:


  • House Trained
  • Likes affection from friends
  • Sweetheart
  • Does well on walks
  • Loves to romp around a yard
  • Treat Motivated
  • Happy Boy


Volunteers have described him as:


  • "A new favorite!"
  • "A total blast!"
  • "I can't wait to get some quality time with this guy because I will love him!"


Bear is available for foster or adoption!

name: Holly
description_html:
Hi, my name is Holly, or Holly Doll as my mom likes to call me. I guess she always tells me that I am such a doll‚Ä¶whatever that means. I want to start off by saying that I am really, really laid back. I think they call me a lap dog, which I laugh at, because I really am too big for your lap, but I enjoy snuggling up all close to you and laying in your lap and giving you tons of affection. I do love playing with my big Boxer sister, but I look forward to my downtime where I can stretch my body out and just relax. I will get along with any dog really, as I am mild mannered and incredibly respectful of their space, food, toys and treats.

I do love a good squeaky toy every now and then, too. I enjoy my walks and I am very, very good on a leash. I get so excited when I see people or other dogs when I am out, but I cannot help it, I enjoy the attention and want to play!!  I am working on controlling my excitement though ‚Äì which is no fun. I appear to be good with kids, although I don‚Äôt currently live with any, but my mom can tell how happy I get when we see kids out and about. I wag my tail really fast and tap my feet and try to pull her near them. I don‚Äôt know if I am good with cats either. I do not currently live with any and we haven‚Äôt come across any on my walks. I can keep you posted though.

I am crate, leash, house and potty trained. I learn very quickly and I love the one-on-one time I get with my mom when she is teaching me.  I am not a big barker, although my Boxer sister sometimes tries to get me to join in with her, but I can resist. I like riding in cars and will jump right in to go anywhere.

Overall, I am a wonderful pup. I can have little bursts of puppy energy, but for most of the day, I am laid back. I am super friendly and sweet.

name: Winston
description_html:
‚≠ê Meet Winston ‚Äî your built-in best mood booster!

Winston is an easygoing, happy boy with a goofy, fun-loving spirit that will keep you smiling. At just 39 pounds, he‚Äôs perfectly pint-sized‚Äîfull of energy without feeling overwhelming. He‚Äôs energetic and ready to go, making him a great match for an active home or a running buddy. Winston also enjoys fetch, knows his sit and down commands, and loves soaking up pets and affection between bursts of play.

He‚Äôs easy to handle, cooperative, and eager to engage with his person. With his adorable face, bright personality, and joyful energy, Winston is the kind of dog who turns everyday moments into fun adventures. üêæ

name: Chip
description_html: Meet Chip! Chip is a curious yet gentle bunny who enjoys exploring and spending time around people on his own terms. He likes to approach for attention and investigation, then retreat to his pen when he's ready to relax. Chip communicates clearly when he needs space, so he'd do best with someone who understands and respects bunny boundaries. He loves head and back rubs, but prefers not to have his feet or belly touched and does not enjoy being picked up. Carrots are his favorite treat, while bananas are a definite no! Chip can be sensitive to loud noises, so a calm home without very young children or dogs would suit him best. With the right introduction, he may also be a good candidate for bonding with another rabbit. Overall, Chip is a sweet, thoughtful bunny who will thrive in a patient, loving home that lets him blossom at his own pace. üê∞üíõ

name: Buttercup
description_html:
This gentle, affectionate pittie came to us thanks to a kind Good Samaritan after she was found abandoned with her five puppies. Even on her first day, Buttercup showed us who she is at heart: calm, trusting, and endlessly loving. She allowed strangers to carry her and handle her puppies without a hint of worry ‚Äî a true testament to her gentle nature.


Her pups, already old enough to be weaned, returned to their finder and are quickly finding homes. Buttercup, however, stayed with us so we could care for an injury to her left front leg that left her a bit lame. X-rays showed no fractures, and with rest, medication, and TLC, she has made a remarkable recovery.


Now Buttercup is ready to take the next step: a foster or adoptive home of her very own.

She has quickly become a staff and volunteer favorite ‚Äî the kind of dog people go out of their way to visit because she brightens everyone‚Äôs day. We would love nothing more than to see her curled up on a soft bed in a real home instead of a kennel.


If you're looking for a gentle, loving companion who will melt your heart, Buttercup is your girl. Come meet her and see why we all adore her.

name: Puma
description_html:
Puma will melt your heart with his crystal blue eye! He is a sweet pup whose bouncy gate will keep you smiling the entire walk. Very house trained and fabulous on a leash, he takes his cues from his guiding human and is definitely down for a cuddle session between activities.


Come meet this little house cow today

name: Stickers
description_html:
Stickers is a bundle of joy who is ready to steal your heart and claim a permanent spot on your sofa! With his soulful brown eyes and a coat as cute as his personality, Stickers is the perfect blend of adventurer and snuggler.

He is an absolute dream on the move; whether you‚Äôre heading for a morning hike or a casual sunset stroll, he‚Äôs an easy walker who handles a leash with good manners. You won't have to worry about the "boring" stuff either‚ÄîStickers is very housetrained and prides himself on being a total gentleman indoors.

When he‚Äôs not showing off his playful side with his favorite toys, he‚Äôs looking for a lap to lean on. He is a world-class cuddler who believes there‚Äôs no such thing as being "too close." If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal, easy-going companion to fill your home with love, Stickers is your guy.

Interested in stickers? Reach out to blueplusbusters@gmail.com for more info!

name: Shady
description_html:
Meet Shady üíï

This little pup has had a rough start but is blossoming into the sweetest companion. Shady is curious, affectionate, and eager to learn what it means to be part of a forever family. She‚Äôs doing great in foster care and is ready to bring love, laughter, and lots of tail wags into her new home. This sweet girl does wonderful with other dogs, and loves children of all ages!

name: Elara
description_html: Elara is a sweet, shy girl who likes dog friends. They help with her confidence.

name: Monty
description_html: Monty is a calm, sweet, and laid-back pup who is easy to get in and out of his kennel. He walks nicely on a loose leash and loves taking his time to sniff along the way. Monty is also a fun-loving happy pup who is cuddly and will chase toys around in the yard. Monty is a smart boy who knows sit, shake, and down, is house trained, and absolutely loves food and treats. This gentle boy would make a wonderful, easygoing companion.

name: Persephone
description_html: This is a feral momma kitty who I have been working on taming in foster with her babies. She's still likely to hiss if approached too quickly and be tightened up as hard as a rock when you touch her, but with some dedication I have gotten her to start relaxing during pets and even put her chin up and press into some neck and chin scritches. Definitely can't pick her up with your hands, but placing a blanket or towel over her makes her limp enough to handle and transport her. I believe she can be domesticated and put into a good home, but it will take continued work. Named Persephone because I got two kittens from her the year before these four kittens, so she was like Persephone coming back from the underworld every year bringing me new pretty babies. She has now been spayed to end that cycle!

name: Sweet Pea
description_html: Sweet Pea is a fun little guy! Loves to play and play battle and run around with the other kittens. He can be a siren sometimes, squealing his cute little head off, but then he calms down and melts. He's the only of his siblings that is sleek rather than a puff ball. A very handsome gentleman!

name: Florence
description_html: Florence doesn't appreciate being stuck in a kennel all day. Kennel life isn't easy on most cats, especially active ladies like Florence. She has many sides; she can be silly and affectionate, and she can also be bossy and ready to share all of her opinions. Florence may do best in a cat-savvy home where she is the only cat. Her bossy nature makes her a good fit for a home in need of a cat-manager; someone to handle the treat inventory, oversee the bird watching, regulate play sessions and make sure her humans are reaching their best potential. Help Florence get a permanent break from the shelter today!

name: Peaches
description_html: Peaches is a very loving and energetic dog. She loves nothing more than pets, love and treats. She doesn‚Äôt know how to play fetch very well but she will love to run around and chase the toys you throw. Peaches is crate trained and does well with other dogs and children

name: Daisy
description_html:
~ Meet Daisy


Daisy arrived with a 30lb dog named Zoe (19500) and try as we did, we could not find a home to take both together. Thankfully they seemed to be independent spirits, so two volunteers each took one dog home and they are now loving their new foster homes with companionship from the people and their resident dogs.


Daisy is the sweetest land seal you could ever meet. She fit right into a single story home with a cattle dog (with a strong personality), and an aloof shepherd mix. She likes being near her people, and her dog friends. Working in the kitchen? She would love to park and observe if that's ok. Something have your dogs in a ker fluffer? Daisy's going to take the high road and steer away, she does not like conflict. She never been known to bark. Her sweet affectionate and gentle nature will make her a wonderful fit in many homes, with a range of human and animal friends of all ages. Her advocates at Classic Canines are getting Daisy a comprehensive exam and she's already working on her "New Year, New You" weight goals.

name: Zoe
description_html:
~ A fresh start in life


Zoe 19500 and Daisey 19501 arrived together and we knew very little except they lived together indoors. They were checked over, vaccinated and observed, and we found they were very independent of each other. Each went to a different volunteer home and have been doing great with the family pets.


Zoe is a sweet medium size lady of about 32 lbs. She adores human affections and having the resident dog siblings to hang out with. She is mannered and fully house trained.


Her advocates at ClassicCaninesATX have taken care to provide a comprehensive exam and she's very healthy.


Zoe makes a wonderful human and dog companion. Reach out on her link to start a conversation.

name: Aspen
description_html: Aspen is a cutie! This sweet young pup has typical Husky characteristics and greets you with excited yips when it‚Äôs time for an exercise break. Aspen walks nicely on leash and enjoys zoomies in the playyard and entertaining herself with toys. She appears dog friendly and is affectionate with her people. Aspen would thrive in a loving home with ample exercise and patient training to grow into her best self.

name: Sandy
description_html: Sandy is a dream puppy with the perfect puppy energy, fun and joyful. She's affectionate and playful, and will sit for cheese and pets. Sandy is a sweetheart. Come meet her!

name: Josie Rosie
description_html: Meet Josie Rosie, an active tripod girl who would love to be a part of your family!

name: Remington
description_html:
Remington is a big, sweet, toy-loving guy who knows how to enjoy life.

 

He‚Äôs got that perfect balance: happy to head out for a walk, toss a toy around, and stretch his legs ‚Äî and just as happy to settle in close once he‚Äôs had his fun. Give him a few minutes and he‚Äôll lean right into you for pets, cuddles, and as much lap time as you‚Äôre willing to offer.

 

He can entertain himself with enrichment, greet people with excited tail wags, and then relax like a pro. Medium energy, affectionate, and easy to love ‚Äî Remington is the kind of dog who fits right into your day.

 

If you‚Äôve been looking for a big-hearted companion with a playful side and a snuggly streak, Remington is ready to meet you.

name: Little Puff
description_html:
Little Puff is a young, curious sweetheart with a soft heart, a smart brain, and a serious appreciation for snacks and snuggles.


Little Puff may be small in name, but he‚Äôs full of personality. He‚Äôs a curious kid who wants to check out the world, then curl up close once the exploring is done. He‚Äôs treat-motivated (read: VERY trainable) and eager to learn, making him a great candidate for basic training and beyond.


This guy works for treats and is proud of it. Whether it‚Äôs learning new skills or practicing good manners, Little Puff is ready to focus if snacks are involved.


After he‚Äôs satisfied his curiosity, Little Puff is all about affection. He loves being close to his people and has a natural talent for cozy moments.


Young, loving, and ready to learn, Little Puff is looking for someone who wants a dog that‚Äôs equal parts playful, trainable, and cuddly. He‚Äôs ready to puff up your life in the best way.


To learn more about Little Puff, reach out at blueplusbusters@gmail.com

name: Gemma
description_html:
Gemma is a super affectionate girl around 2 years old (possibly younger based on her teeth). She‚Äôs likely an American Bully or Staffy mix and weighs about 62 lbs.

Gemma‚Äôs favorite thing in the world is being close to her people. She‚Äôs a total cuddle bug who loves leaning on you, touching you, and sleeping right on top of you like a weighted blanket. She has a goofy, funny personality and is incredibly sweet with people.

She has low-to-medium energy and is happy with a mix of playtime (fetch, tug, chew toys) and lots of naps. She can do well in an apartment as long as she gets daily walks.

Gemma is very strong and currently a big puller on leash, especially when she sees other dogs, so continued leash training will be important. That said, she has shown no aggression on walks and rarely barks. She takes treats gently and is food-motivated, which should make training easier.

At home, Gemma is a dream. She‚Äôs fully potty trained with no accidents, sleeps through the night, and is not destructive. She currently lives with two adults and has done great. Her compatibility with other dogs, cats, and kids is still being evaluated; due to her size and excitement level, she‚Äôd do best with children 10+. Slow, thoughtful introductions to other dogs are recommended.

If you‚Äôre looking for a cuddly, loyal companion with a big heart and a great sense of humor, Gemma might be your perfect match.

See more of her at @keep.austin.furry üíõ

name: Lily
description_html:
Lily is a sweet and friendly girl that loves being around people. When I‚Äôm laying down she likes to lay on my chest and when I‚Äôm working she will occasionally put her feet on my shoulder as if she wants a hug. In fact, when I need a hug I just pick her up to get one and she‚Äôs perfectly fine with it. Definitely not anything I can do with my cats.  She‚Äôs been a very easy cat to take care of and especially to take to the vet. On the way to and from the vet she never meows or complains which makes vet visits a lot less stressful for both of us. She‚Äôs done really well with my cats and seems to enjoys being around them. She would do best with someone who has other cats or works from home.


Lily has been spayed and is up to date on vaccinations.

name: Mama Blythe
description_html: Mama Blythe had some time in foster care where she was extremely sweet and curious towards people. She may be shy at first in a new place, but it doesn't take her long to build trust and confidence. While Mama Blythe enjoys the company of her human friends, she may prefer to be an only pet in the home. This girl is calm and friendly with people, all that she's missing is a sofa and best friend to snuggle up with.

name: Nanner
description_html:
Nanner is a sweetheart! This handsome big boy is quiet in his kennel, easy to leash and walk, and appears housetrained. He enjoys exploring the playyard and is friendly with other dogs along the fence line.


Nanner is gentle, mellow, affectionate and cuddly. He will make a wonderful companion in a loving home.

name: Milo
description_html:
Meet sweet, gentle Milo! This calm & stoic boy is shy at first, but once you‚Äôve gained his trust, you become the center of his world and he shows you his goofy side. Milo was surrendered to the shelter because his family had to leave the country, but he is flourishing in a foster home now and is ready to find his forever people! 

Milo is a mellow, easy pup. He is perfectly housetrained and naps most of the day with the occasional adorable waggly request for some pets. Milo is easy on walks - he doesn't pull on the leash and, while he's curious about things we pass (squirrels, cats, people, other dogs), he shows friendly interest then moves on. He is a quiet boy (very little barking) and takes treats gently from your hand like a dainty prince.

Milo loves sniffs and exploring outside; he would do great in a house with a secure yard or an apartment where he gets lots of good walks. Milo could fit in with most any lifestyle - he‚Äôs laid back so doesn‚Äôt need a ton of exercise/stimulation, but could also be a great running buddy. Milo would be the perfect family dog - he lived with both a child and a cat before the shelter and is currently living with another dog in his foster home. He would especially love to have a canine friend in his forever home who can keep him company and help him build confidence!

And did we mention his ears?! They are magical and definitely deserve some kind of award.

Click ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù on the right to be connected to Milo‚Äôs foster and meet this gentle, soulful boy!

name: Saint
description_html:
Meet Saint ü§çüêæ

Saint lives up to her name‚Äîshe‚Äôs a sweet, gentle girl with a wonderfully calm, laid-back nature. She loves being close to her people and happily leans in for affection, making her a perfect companion for anyone who enjoys quiet moments and cozy snuggles.

This lovely lady is housetrained and walks beautifully on leash, making outings easy and relaxed. Whether she‚Äôs enjoying a peaceful stroll or settling in beside you for cuddle time, Saint brings a soft, comforting presence wherever she goes.

If you‚Äôre looking for a devoted, easygoing companion with a tender heart, Saint might be your perfect match.

name: Reina
description_html: Reina is an adorable, small, wiggly girl. She is shy at first but warms up quickly into a goofy, cuddly goober. She loves rolling in the grass, getting belly and booty rubs, and snuggling in your lap.

name: Cheyenne
description_html:
Meet Cheyenne -


This lovely, gently spirited lady is getting her grounding in a foster home and she's shown us what great home manners she has. She's as sweet as they come and loves affections. She made fast friends with the senior male dog too. She likes to play when he'll oblige, and is respectful when he doesn't. She's the perfect fur friend for home.


One thing on Cheyenne's wish list - she tries hard to run but can't get past a slow trot - she wants to run like the wind, but her left front leg is dragging along and holding her back. It's not been functioning for what appears to be a very long time. She has no pain and also no neurological response from the elbow down so it will be removed on Feb 19th under our medical sponsorship. After her recovery we can't wait to see her gain momentum and then finally run in the wind, never to be held back again by a leg dragging alongside her. She's otherwise very healthy and has years ahead.

See her video to see her "before". Want to keep your eyes on her? Check back here or follow her story on ClassicCaninesATX social media or reach out on her link to her foster VIP's.

You may also write us at caring@classiccanines.org.with questions.

name: Gordon
description_html: What a handsome big boy! That‚Äôs the reaction when you first see Gordon quietly lounging on a blanket in his kennel. This sweet young fellow is a friendly, happy dog who loves to romp around the playyard and check out the surroundings. Gordon is housetrained and walks well with a harness after initial excitement for his exercise break. He shows curious interest in other dogs and is affectionate with his friends. Gordon is a wonderful dog who will make a great companion to the lucky person who welcomes him into their forever home.

name: Kylo Ren
description_html:
This sweet boy arrived with another male dog, an Alaskan Malamute, that was quickly adopted. We learned directly from his people that he also has cat and kid experience. He's gentle on a leash and loves an opportunity to run in the wind when allowed. He's so very friendly. You'll be charmed for sure!


We invite you to come by and meet him. He's advocated for by his friends at ClassicCaninesATX.

name: Morgan
description_html: Morgan & Taylor are young scaredy cats looking for a quiet place to continue working on their people skills. They came in with litter mates after their mother was hit by a car, leaving them trying to survive under a tree in a park. Morgan & Taylor have come a very long way in the shelter, but a home will be the best place for them to truly make progress! They do ‚Äúnose boops‚Äù for Churu, and this is an easy training that can be continued in the home to help them build confidence. They will do best in a low traffic home with a patient, cat savvy person to show them the way! These babies are available for foster or adoption today.

name: Nugget
description_html:
If you have a lap that needs a mutt, Nugget is the guy for you!

He is the perfect size for it and snuggles is his absolute favorite activity.

However, he also understands "Off" and "Give Space" when his lap-needs are too much for you.


Nugget is the perfect size for a house or apartment.

He is 100% house trained. He also tolerates a crate well.

He is good on a walk, short or long leash.

He's current on all vaccinations and has been neutered.


He is an extremely sweet little dude.

He's smart and responsive to training.

Come meet him!

Brutus is a gentle giant. He lounges around most of the day with 3 cats and a bunny. The cats often take over his bed and he allows it. He loves to go on walks and take in all the smells. He is very curious about other dogs but enjoys his space.

A few things to note, he is terrified of thunder, fireworks and any other loud noises. Walks on trash day aren't his favorite and he refuses to go outside if fireworks are being set off... even from quite a distance.

He has so much love to offer and is the perfect mellow couch potato. Crate trained but free roams and is non destructive.

name: Rosco
description_html: Rosco loves to walk and explore outside. He is very friendly towards people he knows, but may be shy making new friends, though it doesn't take him long to relax. Rosco found his way into a home with cats, and it wasn't a good fit, so he may do best without feline friends. He loves to go for runs with our Trail Dog volunteers, so this active boy may be a good walking or jogging buddy. This smart boy would love to learn some tricks! He‚Äôs a great listener and he's ready for his new home today!

name: Sylvester
description_html: Sylvester deserves the world! He was trapped in a dog park by a Community Cats Program volunteer after multiple reports of dogs chasing him. He's blossomed into an incredibly affectionate boy here. He doesn't have much confidence yet, but he's working on building trust with humans. All he needs is a couple minutes of you sweet-talking him and he'll be leaning into your pets and rolling over to enjoy his massage. He just needs a chance to show you how wonderful he is.

name: Cooper
description_html: Cooper is an extremely smart and playful dog who is looking for a forever home. Cooper would love an active family who can take him on walks and play. He loves tug of war, squeaky toys, and chewing bones. He also knows how to sit! Because he‚Äôs so smart and is very food motivated, he would love to learn new tricks. When meeting new people, it‚Äôs best to let him sniff and do a gentle introduction first. Meet Cooper today!

name: Griselda
description_html: Looking for a happy, easy-going, sweet dog? Griselda "Grizzy" is for you! She'll always greet you with a waggy tail & lots of licks! She loves cuddles, long naps & outside adventures. She's leash trained, as well as potty trained & crate trained. She know basic commands (sit, stay, down, come) & will be eager to impress you, especially when treats are involved. She'd be a great fit for almost any type of household, including a home with kids or an elderly person. In her current foster home, she gets along well with their energetic 50 lb doodle, even though she's 1/3 in size. A warning about Grizzy: she's bound to steal your heart the 1st time you meet!

name: Coco Melon
description_html:
Coco Melon had to be surrendered due to allergies. While she may be shy with strangers, once she gets to know you she's super friendly and loving. She loves playing with squeaky toys and this smart girl knows Spanish commands for "sit" and "paw"! Coco Melon is a special girl looking to be the center of attention in her new home.


Coco Melon is the cuddliest girl!

name: Bandit
description_html:
Bandit arrived with another dog, displaced after a house fire. Despite that big interruption to his life, he's a cheerful guy who loves and bonds so nicely to all of his helpers here. He loves opportunities to be outdoors and especially loves playing with toys and having a good chew.

Have a resident dog? Set up a meet and greet while you're visiting the shelter.

Check in at the front desk to meet him or if you are offsite, reach out to his advocates online at ClassicCaninesATX or email: caring@classiccanines.org - we aim to make Bandit's transition home an easy one for adopters by helping with a first exam and providing an online gift card for supplies so you can focus on welcoming your new pet home.

name: Marcela
description_html: Marcela is a tender soul with a journey full of joy and sorrow. Part of a family for 4 years, her life took a turn that left her feeling lost and alone. Since then she's found places to go, but not her happy, stable place to stay in life,,, nothing has been forever. Most recently she was found alone on IH-130. The Animal Protection Officer who picked her up described her as a "Very sweet girl, just takes a lot of time to warm up". Marcela knows all about abandonment, yet simple kindness, and a sense of calm, and acceptance, is the door to her heart. It doesn't take long to unlock the warmth and affections. She's a great house mate and especially cherishes quiet moments of connection with her people, interlaced with some playful moments and toys here and there. Do you have a calm relaxed home for Marcela to feel secure and loved in that you might like to share with her? We invite you to visit her soon or reach out to her advocates at caring@classiccanines.org.

name: Cassini
description_html:
Cassini is a sweet and smart girl! As cute as can be, she is gentle and allows all kinds of handling (bath, wiping paws, picking her up when needed). The vet at the shelter said she was the easiest patient they‚Äôve seen.


She is very food/treat motivated and learns commands easily. ‚ÄúSit, ‚Äúdown‚Äù and ‚Äúcrate‚Äù are 100%, and we‚Äôre working on ‚Äústay‚Äù and ‚Äúcome.‚Äù In spite of her puppy energy, she can also be very chill and loves to snuggle. She readily goes in her crate and settles.


We have a very old dog and she is respectful of him. She is very interested in our cats, but has been getting more relaxed with them over time. Definitely playful and not agressive. She‚Äôs met a 7-year-old human child and was an angel with her.


Potty training is going well - she has never gone in her crate, even overnight, and goes potty outside easily when prompted. She hasn‚Äôt yet figured out how to signal that she needs to go out, so we make sure to take her out in the yard consistently.


She is good on a leash and has been enjoying regular neighborhood walks.


She‚Äôs a real gem of a pup and with training will be an amazing family dog! Text Beckie for more info! 512-202-8868.

name: Carmelita
description_html:
Meet Carmelita üíï your future favorite cuddle buddy.


Carmelita is a sweet, affectionate, medium-sized gal (about 50 lbs). She is 100% a cuddle dog and will proudly volunteer as your little spoon any chance she gets. If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal companion who loves to cuddle on the couch- She‚Äôs your girl.


She‚Äôs also a dream in the home:

  • ‚úÖ Fully crate trained ‚Äî sleeps in her crate overnight for up to 12 hours and goes in willingly during the day


  • ‚úÖ Potty trained ‚Äî no issues with potty training. She learned to do her business outside by day 2. I had her for 3 weeks and we had no issues with accidents. She typically poops once a day in the morning and does her business IMMEDIATELY when you let her outside. No hemming and hawing there.


  • üçñ Very food motivated, which makes her eager to learn and train. Will eat absolutely anything you give her and inhales her food, we used a slow feeder.


Carmelita is working on her leash manners and she‚Äôs making quick progress! a great sign of her potential with continued guidance and consistency. In our 3 weeks together she progressed very quickly with leash training, with treats and attention distraction she doesn‚Äôt bark or have reactivity.


She has the cutest little prance / trot that she does when excited and these adorable low

vocals at meal time (see video).


She is not vocal during the day unless she sees people outside the windows. If she can‚Äôt see outside, she‚Äôs quite as a mouse.


She doesn‚Äôt show any separation anxiety and goes in her crate no problem during the day when you‚Äôre leaving. She doesn‚Äôt bark in the crate and is a real angel with crate time. Goes right in at bedtime.


I did not have other pets or kids in the home with Carmelita but she sees kids on a walks and greets them and wiggles her butt. She loves kids, I believe she came from a home with kids because she always wanted to greet and interact with children.


I also think she may speak Spanish, lol. She is very attracted to Spanish speaking. I bet she knows commands in Spanish (I do not speak Spanish unfortunately).


I did not get to test her with other dogs but she is playful and curious by nature and not aggressive.

She is obsessed with sniffing and spends half her walk sniffing. She also loves water! (See video).


She knows commands like sit and wait (see video). She will patiently wait in her crate while you feed her meals until you ‚Äúrelease‚Äù her with an ‚Äúokay‚Äù.


I would love to answer any questions you may have about Carmelita. Feel free to email me at cori@alitelaser.com.


Carmelita is ready to find her forever home ‚Äî and her forever couch. üêæüíñ

name: Macie
description_html:
Macie is the definition of good-natured. She‚Äôs still got that puppy sparkle in her soul ‚Äî playful, bouncy, and full of joy ‚Äî but everything she does comes with sweetness and love.


She‚Äôs currently in foster care working on her manners (like leash pulling), and she‚Äôs learning fast! With a little consistency and a lot of praise, this girl is going to shine.


üêï Dog-friendly? Yes! She can be a bit pushy‚Ä¶ but in a very ‚Äúhi let‚Äôs be BEST FRIENDS RIGHT NOW‚Äù puppy way.

üêà Cat-friendly? Also yes! She adores cats and just wants to play ‚Äî zero mean bone in her body.

üéæ Favorite games? Fetch is LIFE. Tug-of-war is a close second.

üöó Car rides? She‚Äôs great in the car and ready for adventures.

üë©‚Äçü¶∞üë®‚Äçü¶± People? Obsessed. Macie loves every human she meets like she‚Äôs known them forever.


Fully house trained and crate trained.


Macie is young, happy, affectionate, and overflowing with love. She‚Äôs the kind of dog that makes your house feel warmer and your days a little brighter.


Honestly‚Ä¶ what more could you ask for? üíï


üì© If you‚Äôre ready for a playful, loving companion who will adore you endlessly, Macie is waiting.

name: Courage
description_html:
Courage is a sweet, sensitive boy with a heart full of love‚Äîhe‚Äôs just waiting for the right person to help him feel safe enough to share it. Shelter life is overwhelming for him, and he‚Äôs understandably scared in this noisy, unfamiliar environment. What he needs most is someone patient, kind, and willing to give him a little space to come out of his shell at his own pace.

When you let Courage approach you on his terms, he shows you who he truly is: a gentle treat‚Äëtaker, a soft hand‚Äëkisser, and a dog who wants so badly to trust. He moves carefully through the world, taking time to understand his surroundings, but every small step he takes is full of bravery.

He walks politely on a leash and stays close, though sudden noises and quick movements can startle him. With time, consistency, and a calm home, he‚Äôs sure to blossom into the cuddle bug he‚Äôs meant to be.

Courage has the most soulful eyes‚Äîeyes that quietly ask for kindness, patience, and love. You can see how much he wants to bond, to feel safe, and to finally relax into a family of his own.

If you‚Äôre looking for a gentle companion who will reward your patience with deep, loyal love, Courage is waiting for you.

name: Holt
description_html:
Meet Holt


He's very unique - a Belgian Shepherd Laekenois mix.

He's smart, fun and funny, and a great guy to have around. He's living urban style right now and take the elevator? Yes please...when he gets to his apartment he's happy to stay and be quiet and content for a few hours while making your place look very photogenic from your web cam (just in case you want to show him off to your co-workers). He makes each room look a little more plush and regal with his presence.

He's a nice friend to walk with too - pulling on a leash is a rarity - sure he's going to crane his neck to watch a squirrel but he's not giving chase. He passes other dogs with a subtle "hi" and while he was at the shelter he went to doggy play groups. Have a friend at home for him? We'll schedule a meet up.

Holt is neutered and heart worm negative and ready to meet up with adopters right away. Reach out on his link to connect with his fosters or write his advocates at caring@classiccanines.org.

name: Daisy
description_html: Daisy is a sweet and submissive senior female chihuahua possibly mixed with a Rat Terrier. She has had some downsides with having to move homes due to no fault of her own. This leads to taking some time and love to adjust into her forever home again. She would do best in a calm home with someone who works from home or is retired. She is good with well behaved children but does best with adults. She is looking for a loyal owner who understands and knows how to be patient and empathetic towards animals especially while she builds trust that this will be her forever.

name: Dolce
description_html:
Meet Dolce, an incredibly happy lady with a constant helicopter tail who is always ready to get in the mix of friends and family. Her energy level is adjustable, which means she is equally happy to nap on your lap or go on a 2-hour hike. Despite being seven, Dolce indulges in the world with an infectious puppy energy. She loves her occasional zoomies, grass rolls, back scratches, and 20 minutes later, you might find her curled up for a nap. See her short video here!


Dolce does not seem bothered by small animals that make their home nearby, including squirrels, birds, and even stray cats. We think she might enjoy having a dog friend. If you have a resident dog at home, you can set up a doggie meet with her.


From her foster parents: Dolce is a dream doggo that seems almost too good to be true. Being the very trusting and loving bundle of joy that she is, Dolce is a perfect embodiment of her name and warmed up to us with belly rubs just within our first few minutes of meeting her. She is extremely affectionate and is almost guaranteed to snuggle right next to you and politely request scratches if you sit down at her level.


Dolce is extremely well-trained (house-, potty-, crate-, leash-trained!) and responds very well to commands like 'sit', 'leave it', 'come here', and 'out'. She also has not had a single accident since joining our home. She appears to be familiar with apartment environments and is confident with stairs and elevators. Dolce also has not reacted to any person, animal, or object (including a guy biking by with a broom!) and responds very well to redirections (verbal commands or tugging the leash). This also means she is an absolute dream on the leash (no pulling at all). Dolce is a classic gentle giant - picking up treats carefully from our hands and nudging her head into our hands for more pets. She is also crate-trained, and demonstrated this on her first night by heading straight to her crate the moment we brought her into our home and consistently sleeping/napping in there.


Dolce is a little overweight as of early Jan 2026, but we are working on lots of exercise and a balanced diet to get her back to her healthy self (and relieve some pressure from those joints!). She is already showing promising signs - she aced long walks and short runs with amazing energy, and has already gotten used to being hand-fed a healthy amount of food throughout the day.


If you are interested in sweet Dolce, please reach out for a meet and greet! We know Dolce would be 10000% thrilled to see and get to know you, and you will get to see her almost fly away with her tail! :)


More short videos of Dolce that showcase her personality:

Dolce showing off her sitting ability!

Dolce making conversation!

Dolce CANNOT wait to go on a walk! (and she's a dream on the leash!)

name: Nellie
description_html:
Nellie is the sweetest and most affectionate little girl you've ever met!


She loves snuggles and pets and is always very happy to sit or nap next to her humans, though she can also be independent and go nap on her bed if they're busy.


She loves playing fetch, she loves her toys and won't turn down a tug of war with them (and will gently place it back in your hand every time she wins so you can keep playing... ADORABLE), and seems very attentive to commands and cues.


She is house trained and can be left alone in the home. Every time her humans come back, they find her napping quietly on her bed.


Nellie knows sit and is enthusiastically learning other tricks. She responds quickly to recall in the yard, but haven't tried it yet out in an unfenced area. She's a pretty good walker, she can sometimes pull a bit when she gets excited, but is learning and improving every day. She doesn't bark or show any aggression toward other dogs we pass on our walks.


If you're looking for a loving and gentle companion who will fill your days with sweet looks and dog kisses, Nellie is your girl!

name: Bosco
description_html: Bosco prefers hiding when he feels scared! And, that's a lot of the time in the shelter. He was found inside someone's truck and brought to the safety of the shelter. Clearly he was looking for a free Uber out of parking lot life! This shy guy enjoys pets but would much rather have a quiet, calm space to relax. Bosco is looking for someone to give him a second chance at a life of love and family!

name: Thelma
description_html:
Thelma was found running in the busy road right outside of the shelter. Thankfully she was caught before anything happened to her, and she is now at Austin Animal Services!


Thelma may give a few barks when you walk by her kennel but once that gate is open she can‚Äôt get into your lap fast enough! If you are looking for a cuddle bug then this is your girl!


üíõ Sweetheart

üíõ Cuddly

üíõ Playful

üíõ Great on Leash

üíõ Treat Motivated

üíõ Volunteer Favorite

name: Chili Pepper
description_html: Chili Pepper has a lot of feelings about the shelter, and they are all very mixed! Sometimes she likes us, sometimes she doesn‚Äôt. Sometimes she wants pets, sometimes she wants us to go away. The shelter can have this effect on smart, sassy girls like Chili Pepper. This girl is unique because she has thumbs! We think what she really needs is a home to relax in away from the stress of the shelter and other cats. She enjoys pets in moderation here, but she would probably be a super affectionate girl in a calm home setting. She‚Äôs just telling us she deserves better than a kennel!

name: Scout
description_html: Scout is a striking 6yo tuxedo cat who is a true companion at heart. She is a social girl who loves nothing more than being around her people and will often be found curled up right on the bed for a long nap. Scout is an expert at finding the coziest hiding spots for a deep sleep, but she also has a fun, energetic side that comes out during her nightly zoomies. She is incredibly easy to please, showing enthusiasm for every toy she finds and excitement for any treat offered to her. Scout tells us she prefers to be the only pet in the home so that she can be adored for all her unique qualities!

name: Oso
description_html: Oso has the kind of soul that quietly steals your heart and never gives it back. At 4 years old, he is gentle, deeply loving, and just wants to belong to a family of his own. He melts into cuddles, leans into love, and looks at you like you‚Äôre his whole world. Oso is wonderful with kids, adores other dogs, and greets everyone he meets with warmth and trust. When the weather turns cold, he happily snuggles up in his little jammies, perfectly content just being close. Oso isn‚Äôt just looking for a home‚Äîhe‚Äôs waiting for his people, the ones he can love forever. If you meet him, you‚Äôll understand why he‚Äôs impossible to forget. üíôüêæ

name: Kirby
description_html:
Meet Kirby, a handsome friendly guy


He's known what it's like to work his way up the ladder of life,, to safety, to wellness, to love and belonging. And then having it all knocked down in hardship to have to start over,, for reasons not under his control. He may be stripped bare to the heart, but he's willing and wanting to start,,anew.

He grew up with 2 children. He's had a lady dog friend about his own size. He loves being part of something larger than just himself. He's plenty of energy and fun. He's also crate trained for times you need to be away or if you're traveling with this handsome guy. What a bonus! And if it couldn't get any better, he has lots of friends and fans including ClassicCaninesATX providing an extra layer of support for adopters and fosters of the mature dog crowd. Put Kirby on your list to meet.

name: Indy
description_html:
Meet Indy ‚Äì Your Future Adventure Buddy & Professional Cuddle Companion! üêæ

Indy is a smart, playful girl with a big heart and an even bigger love for her people. She truly believes everyone she meets is her new best friend ‚Äî and she‚Äôs not wrong. üíõ


This bright girl is always ready to run and wrestle with her dog friends! She was in a foster home with a 9-year-old Mini Aussie and a 2-year-old Lab and loved every minute of playtime. Indy shows zero aggression and would absolutely thrive in a home with another young, playful dog to help burn off her energy.


When the fun winds down, Indy transforms into the ultimate cuddle bug. She loves to curl up behind you while you nap and is happiest when she‚Äôs close to her person. If left alone, she may cry a little ‚Äî she just really loves company! With her people, though, she‚Äôs calm, quiet, and affectionate.


Indy is incredibly smart and picks up on new things quickly. She enjoys puzzle toys, Kongs, durable chew toys, and bones ‚Äî especially the indestructible kind! Mealtime is serious business for Indy; she eats dry food and inhaled it, so a slow feeder works great to help her pace herself.


She‚Äôs still working on her house training and will need consistency and patience as she continues learning. Frequent potty breaks (about every 30 minutes when someone is home) have helped her succeed, but she may have accidents if left alone too long. Indy is also not a fan of crates and has proven she‚Äôs quite the escape artist, so a home prepared to work on positive crate training ‚Äî or explore alternative management solutions ‚Äî will be important.


On leash, Indy doesn‚Äôt pull but is easily distracted by the exciting world around her. With her quick mind and eagerness to learn, she has great potential to become a wonderful walking partner.


Indy‚Äôs Ideal Home:

  • Another young, playful dog
  • Active adults who can provide structure and training
  • Someone home often (she loves companionship!)
  • Plenty of durable toys and enrichment


If you‚Äôre looking for a playful best friend who will keep you laughing, learning, and snuggling, Indy might just be your girl. üê∂üíï

name: River
description_html: River showed up at the home of a nice person who gave her a chance indoors and she blossomed. While she may be shy in a kennel, she is lovable and affectionate in the home. She has a cute little void face and big eyes that blink slowly when we chat with her. She may do well with a cat friend (as most cats who come from outdoors do). River is looking for a calm place to relax and show her true self.

name: Victoria
description_html:
Cuddly, sweet, a good listener, respectful, a good learner - all these things describe Victoria.

She's never over the top, she's just right. She's stunning inside and out.


Like all very young dogs, she's perfectly moldable and tailorable with a little guidance from her very important people. .


Stop by so she can charm you.

name: Vittorio
description_html: Vittorio is a compact model of love and charm that comes equipped with extra peripheral vision. He knows a thing or two about keeping a tidy house, as he keeps his kennel clean and seems house trained. While he may look worried, that's just him waiting to see if his attempts at telepathy are working--he wants to read your mind, share his own ideas with you, and make you happy! He can't wait to show you he's the goodest boy who loves back scratches, playing fetch, and walks with you on the other end of his leash!

name: Winter
description_html:
Winter is currently in a foster home and her foster reports that she is‚Ä¶.perfect! Winter is completely house trained, and has never had an accident. She has also learned the dog door. She is currently living with 3 other dogs, both big and small, and coexists beautifully. She can also be left alone in the house for several hours without issue.


Winter hops right into the car and is a well behaved passenger.


It appears Winter could do well in most homes. She is extremely cuddly and affectionate.

name: Millie
description_html:
Milano is sharing her kennel with another small dog at the corner of a busy hallway and together they are more than happy to announce all passing visitors. Milano is an alerter, a very sweet one. She's been a little shy at first but nice for handling. She seems house trained, keeping her kennel clean and dry.


She's co-housing with Valley 20717 for now, another female dog. We would love for one or both to find their loving, safe people popping up from around the corner near their kennel to make a love connection like none other. You're invited to come by.




.

name: Tilly
description_html:
Tilly is a gentle giant. She‚Äôs kind, sweet, loving and very well mannered. She‚Äôs great on the leash, never tugs or pulls, which is great for someone her size. Very easy to walk, gets curious about other dogs and people but if you let her say hello she is so kind and playful. 


She‚Äôs still a puppy so has some puppy tendencies like jumping to say hello but listens when you tell her not to. She knows sit and lay down and knows to lay in her bed. Shes potty trained as well. 


With Tilly being so large, it would be great for her to find a family with a big back yard! She is a big cuddler and loves being by your side too!

name: Gracie
description_html:
Hi, I‚Äôm Gracie! I‚Äôve only been with my foster mom for a few days, but it took about two seconds for her to see what a big sweetheart I am. She‚Äôs still getting to know me, but here‚Äôs what she knows so far.


I love lots of pets, and I am a total lovebug.


My favorite place to nap is in my foster mom‚Äôs lap or cuddled right next to her.


I‚Äôm still getting to know my foster sibling, Ollie the Cavapoo. We live peacefully together, and I‚Äôm happiest staying close to my foster mom.


I may be happiest as the only dog, but I could also do well with the right canine companion. My ideal canine match would be a calm dog who naturally knows when to give other dogs space. 


I‚Äôm working hard on potty training and learning that outside is the right place to go. I‚Äôve never gone in my crate, so my foster mom thinks I‚Äôll pick this up quickly. Like any pup, I‚Äôll do best with a little patience, consistency, and lots of praise as I keep learning!


I‚Äôm ultimately looking for a home where I‚Äôll receive lots of love and have a close companion. If you‚Äôre interested in a sweet girl who will steal your heart, please fill out my adoption application!

name: The Duchess Of Purr
description_html:
The Duchess was in foster care and this is what her foster had to say about her!


"She‚Äôs the sweetest. She‚Äôs extremely in tune with people. She loves nibbling on fingers and toes but will respect boundaries. Loves to party at 3 am. Purrs like a symphony. Will attack the vacuum. 10/10 lovely cat and deserves a loving home."


This girl is pretty scared at the shelter, so we would love to see her back in a home ASAP! Adopt The Duchess of Purr today and give her a stress-free life in a loving home.

name: Lucius
description_html:
Meet Lucius! üêæ

Lucius is a sweet, smiley boy with a tender heart and gentle nature. He‚Äôs housetrained, walks beautifully on leash, and is very treat-motivated‚Äîmaking him an easy companion to spend time with.

A little shy at first, Lucius can be timid in new situations and may pull when he feels unsure, but he warms up with patience and kindness. Once comfortable, his soft personality and quiet sweetness really shine.

If you‚Äôre looking for a gentle, sensitive pup who just needs a little confidence and a lot of love, Lucius could be your special guy.

name: Cupid
description_html: Prepare to fall in love with Cupid! Don't say we didn't warn you about this lovable guy. He craves affection and will stick close to you on outings. Cupid is an excellent walker on leash, and though the shelter may be overwhelming for him, we think he could really flourish in a quiet space with patient, loving people to get him back on track. Just in time for Valentines, meet the new love of your life today with Cupid!

name: Marisela
description_html: Marisela is a very affectionate older girl who is done trying to survive on the streets! She was someone's pet at some point, but arrived at the shelter very underweight and in need of some TLC. Marisela is now on the right path! She could use lots of treats and special snacks to plump her up and a cozy home to call her own. Marisela is one of the friendliest cats you could meet. She loves pets and attention, and will likely want to be right by her favorite person's side for snuggles.

name: Ozzy
description_html: Ozzy is a very happy, playful dog! He is still adjusting to having only eye, occasionally bumping into things, but it hasn‚Äôt affected his mood at all. He is constantly smiling and wagging his tail, and he is very eager to love and find someone that will cuddle with him! I‚Äôve had no issues with him in his crate while I‚Äôm at work during the day. He does like to occasionally mark so I‚Äôve put a belly band on him and it doesn‚Äôt bother him one bit! He is already neutered and is truly a ‚Äúgo with the flow‚Äù pup!

name: Remy
description_html: Remy is a cuddler who loves to spend time with his people. He will follow you around and make sure to keep you company. He had to be surrendered when his original owners moved out of the house. Remy is pretty shy at the shelter, but he enjoys gentle pets and you can tell it comforts him. This boy is available for foster or adoption today!

name: Sienna
description_html:
~8 month old female pitbull/blue heeler mix found early January 2026 abandoned at a tow yard. Her previous owners did not want her back despite multiple attempts to reach out to them and she was found with multiple scars on her snout and body. She has been spayed and had her rabies and heartworm updated recently through AAS.


She is an energetic and playful pup that loves walks, food, attention and people. She is also very cuddly and has no concept of personal space.


She is currently being housetrained and cratetrained and has been significantly improving over the last few weeks. She has been healing well during her time in foster, both physically and emotionally, and is looking to find her forever home.

Very Sweet boy. Owner had passed away and apartment management just put him outside which he didn‚Äôt do well. He was picked on while outside by other cats and humans so he is shy but quickly warms up when he feels safe

name: Osiris
description_html: Osirus was surrendered to the shelter due to a sudden change in behavior in his home. He's very scared in the shelter so it has been hard to get to know him. We recommend a low traffic home without small children for this beautiful boy. He may need time to settle into a new space and get to know new people, so please don't rush him! Osirus is available for adoption today.

name: Oliver
description_html:
Oliver came to us off the street in South Austin. He is such a sweet guy and has been easy going from the day we brought him in. Hes very laid back but still enjoys getting out on walks. He gets along great with our dogs and the neighbors. He has also been great with cats. He hasnt been around any children yet but I dont see that being an issue.


He know a few commands and is easily treat motivated. I have taken him on a few car rides to adventure around and he is super chill in the car and lays down in the back seat.


Oliver is a medium energy level dog. He loves taking long walks but when hes at home hes very content to lay in his bed and nap.


I can see him fitting into almost anyones home.

name: Marco
description_html:
Meet Marco!


At just 7 months old, Marco has already proven he‚Äôs a fighter. After recovering from a fractured leg (likely from a run-in with a car), this Belgian Malinois is just two weeks away from being 100% cleared for action!


Because of his history, Marco is looking for a "fear-free" advocate. He is currently nervous around cars (he can get a bit shaky and barky), but he‚Äôs already showing progress through desensitization. He can also be reactive around other dogs, so he would be best fit in a household where he is the center of attention.


If you love the Belgian Malinois breed and enjoy the reward of building a dog‚Äôs confidence, Marco is your guy. He has the brainpower to do anything, he just needs a partner to show him the world isn't so scary after all.

name: Cupcake
description_html:
Meet Cupcake, a free-spirited, cheerful soul eager to move on to the next chapter of her life. She's not one to slow down and wait for affections, there's too much to see and do!

Cupcake maintains a clean kennel, suggesting she is housetrained. She loves adventure walks.

Her backend seems a little sensitive so she's not a fan of being picked up - this may change when she can finally stretch and exercise more. For now she's simply a sweet lady who wants her safe independence in an adult home and we really want to help her to attain that.

Her microchip lead to a string of heartbreak and we don't have useful home information. A dog meet up can be arranged after meeting her. Her kennel is directly across from cat cages and she doesn't seem to mind seeing them. Any day now we know her Valentine will be waiting just around the kennel corner from her. Hurry in to meet her.
